title: Hertz Bondholders Seek More Cash Amid Stock’s Comeback
sub_head: The car-rental company’s bondholders continue fighting for roughly $270 million in premiums and interest that Hertz says they aren’t entitled to
body:
Hertz Global Holdings Inc. bondholders argued the formerly bankrupt rental-car provider shouldn’t get to shower money on shareholders without paying roughly $270 million in bond premiums and interest stemming from its chapter 11 case.
The bankruptcy deal that lifted Hertz out of chapter 11 last summer came after a bidding war that drove up the company’s value enough to cover its debts in full and provide a recovery to equity holders.
